definition: to pass a university entrance exam
to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]

sentences.english: They are to live up to expectations, in our study hard, under-funded, university.
sentences.chinese: 他們很爭氣，在我們的資助下用功讀書，考上大學。

sentences.english: Su Yinyin's family were thrilled when she won a place at university.
sentences.chinese: 當蘇盈盈考上大學時，她們全家都爲此興奮不已。

sentences.english: The following year, Visa admitted Tsinghua University, the girls became even sat with him.
sentences.chinese: 次年，老狼考上清華，那女孩竟然與他成了同桌。

sentences.english: I have thousands of people in our village only one admitted to Yongzhou one .
sentences.chinese: 我是我們村裏幾千人只有一個考上永州一中。
你是以第一名考上的，是麼？

sentences.english: If I hadn't gone to Shantou University, I wouldn't have move to Shantou.
sentences.chinese: 如果我沒有考上汕頭大學，我就不用搬到汕頭去了。

sentences.english: Later, he entered the Beijing Film Academy.
sentences.chinese: 後來，他考上了北京電影學院。

sentences.english: Except for a cousin, I was the first in my family to go to college.
sentences.chinese: 除了一個遠房堂兄，我是家裏第一個考上大學的人。

sentences.english: Amy is enrolled by the university as graduate student. The metamorphosis finally succeeded.
sentences.chinese: 阿媚考上了，這種我看來的一種蛻變終於成功了。

sentences.english: Had not you better not mention it in the sunny morning? I failed.
sentences.chinese: 這陽光燦爛的早上你別提它不行麼？我沒考上。

sentences.english: Albert Einstein was a high school dropout and failed his university entrance exams.
sentences.chinese: 愛因斯坦高中輟學，也沒考上大學。

sentences.english: He had been matriculated in the university.
True, Einstein did not pass the college exam the first time he took it.
sentences.chinese: 的確，愛因斯坦第一次考大學沒考上。

sentences.english: In 1986, high Hongbing in brutal competition admitted to the University Entrance Examination.
sentences.chinese: 1986年，高紅兵在殘酷的高考競爭中考上大學。

sentences.english: As he didn't study hard , he failed in the entrance examination.
sentences.chinese: 由於他學習不努力，沒能考上大學。

sentences.english: You are good enough. You can go to the ideal college.
sentences.chinese: 你非常優秀，你能考上你理想的大學的。

definition: to gain entry by passing an exam/to be admitted to (a college etc)
to pass entrance exam/to enter college after a competitive exam
to pass an entrance exam/to be admitted to
to return to the same school and repeat a course from which one has already graduated, as a result of failing to get good enough results to progress to one's desired higher-level school
the Great Learning, one of the Four Books 四書|四书[Si4 shu1] in Confucianism
university/college/CL:所[suo3]
to enter oneself for an examination

college entrance exam (especially as abbr. for 普通高等學校招生全國統一考試|普通高等学校招生全国统一考试[Pu3 tong1 Gao1 deng3 Xue2 xiao4 Zhao1 sheng1 Quan2 guo2 Tong3 yi1 Kao3 shi4])/(Tw) entrance exam for senior government service posts (abbr. for 公務人員高等考試|公务人员高等考试)
to fail the imperial exams/to flunk
graduate student/postgraduate student/research student
to accept an applicant (prospective student, employee etc) who passes an entrance exam/to admit (a student)/to hire (a job candidate)
undergraduate course/undergraduate (attributive)
to read/to study
lit. to fall behind Sun Shan 孫山|孙山[Sun1 Shan1] (who came last in the imperial examination) (idiom)/fig. to fail an exam/to fall behind (in a competition)
to recommend (for admission to school)
to attend graduate school
to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father
